content: sherri crochets & crafts proudly presents honey bee bug-a-boo pattern designed by sherri bush copyright march 2008 this pattern may not be distributed or sold by anyone other than myself you may make and construct this pattern and sell what you make from this pattern but you may not sell or give away the pattern itself page 1 of 5 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com honey bee bug-a-boo pattern difficulty medium i assume you already know how to crochet how to crochet in the round how to read a pattern and how to sew pieces together supplies size g hook worsted weight yarn red heart super saver works nicely  black  yellow  white  polyfil gauge is unimportant for this project terms  single_crochet = single_crochet  half_double_crochet = half-double_crochet  double_crochet = double_crochet  tc = triple crochet  increase = increase two crochets in the same stitch  decrease = decrease crochet two stitches together  work even = single_crochet in each single_crochet around  leave at least an 8 tail when you bind off each piece you can then use that tail to sew the pieces to the bug-a-boo later on  weave in starting tails as you go note bug-a-boo s are worked in the round unless otherwise stated when i crochet i join rounds and i single_crochet in the same space as joining so i m assuming that at the end of each round you are slip stitching to the first stitch of that round and that you chain 1 to start the next round you can work in spirals if that s easier for you just remember to mark your rounds you want your stitches tight and close together so the stuffing doesn t show through later on to start each piece you can chain 2 and work your 6 stitches into the 2nd stitch from the hook or you can use the magic_ring make lots of bug-a-boo s in various colors sizes and textures be creative and have fun page 2 of 5 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com buggy head row instruction stitches 1 using yellow 6 start by chaining 2 or use a magic_ring and make 6 single_crochet in the second chain from the hook slip_stitch to join and chain 1 2 make 2 single_crochet in each single_crochet around 12 3 *1 single_crochet 1 increase* around 18 4 *2 single_crochet 1 increase* around 24 5 work even single_crochet in each single_crochet around 24 7 8 *2 single_crochet 1 decrease* around 18 9 *1 single_crochet 1 decrease* around 12 bind off leaving a long tail to sew the head to the body later on stuff the head firmly with polyfil buggy body row instruction stitches 1 starting with black 6 start by chaining 2 or use a magic_ring and make 6 single_crochet in the second chain from the hook slip_stitch to join and chain 1 2 make 2 single_crochet in each
